Alton & Sangamon Railroad Stock Subscription Book, 20 May 18471 SpringfieldStock BookFor theAlton and Sangamon Rail Road CompanyopenedMay 20th1847– We the subsribers to the Capital Stock of theAlton and Sangamon Rail Road Compnyeach
               one for himself in consideration of receiving certificates for the shares of the Stock
               of said Company
               fromSimeon Ryderthe President of the board of Commissioners authorized to open the Books for the
               subscription to said stock upon which we have paid Five Dollars on each share which
               number of Shares
               have been hereinafter subscribed by each of us, do hereby agree in consideration of
               haveing received
               such Certificates for Shares of said stock. and in consideration of being one of said
               Stockholders by
               subscribing therefor to pay the balance of the instalments due on Stock by us subscribed
               when the same
               may be called for by the board of Directors of said Company when duly organized in
               conformity with<Page 4>the charter approved Feby[February] 27th1847–2 ^30 Blanks to Stuart.^County Subscriptions to the Capital Stock of the "Alton & Sangamon Rail Road
               Company"

SpringfieldStock BookFor theAlton and Sangamon Rail Road CompanyopenedMay 20th1847–

We the subsribers to the Capital Stock of theAlton and Sangamon Rail Road Compnyeach
               one for himself in consideration of receiving certificates for the shares of the Stock
               of said Company
               fromSimeon Ryderthe President of the board of Commissioners authorized to open the Books for the
               subscription to said stock upon which we have paid Five Dollars on each share which
               number of Shares
               have been hereinafter subscribed by each of us, do hereby agree in consideration of
               haveing received
               such Certificates for Shares of said stock. and in consideration of being one of said
               Stockholders by
               subscribing therefor to pay the balance of the instalments due on Stock by us subscribed
               when the same
               may be called for by the board of Directors of said Company when duly organized in
               conformity with<Page 4>the charter approved Feby[February] 27th1847–2

^30 Blanks to Stuart.^County Subscriptions to the Capital Stock of the "Alton & Sangamon Rail Road
               Company"

footnotes.text: 1Abraham Lincoln signed his name on page eight.

2“An Act to Construct a Railroad from Alton, in Madison County, to Springfield, in
                  Sangamon County,” 27 February 1847,Private and Special Laws of Illinois(1847), 144-49.
3John Robison could not be positively identified.
4Lincoln signed his name, and he also wrote the “2” and the “200.”
5This individual could not be positively identified.
